metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33500 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: PuTTY before 0.75 on Windows allows remote servers to cause a denial of service (Windows GUI hang) by telling the PuTTY window to change its title repeatedly at high speed, which results in many SetWindowTextA or SetWindowTextW calls. NOTE: the same attack methodology may affect some OS-level GUIs on Linux or other platforms for similar reasons.

criterions.comment: putty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
